basics.name: Ethan Grinberg
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Full Stack Developer, Data Scientist, and Researcher

work.description: As an Undergraduate Research Assistant at the Media and Advertising Lab at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, I provided crucial support to a range of research projects by contributing my skills in data processing, analysis, and visualization.
contributions: Successfully developed and implemented Python algorithms for extracting attention metrics from high-dimensional mobile phone log data, resulting in deeper understanding of participants' behavior

Conducted advanced time series sentiment analysis of movie scripts using state-of-the-art natural language processing tools (Spacy, NLTK) and machine learning techniques (Sklearn) resulting in new understanding of movie story structure
Created key data visualizations and analyses in Python, Pandas, Altair for research paper accepted to ICA conference in Paris, France
Utilized BS4 and Selenium in developing web scrapers, resulting in a significant time-saving and improved accuracy of data collection for analyses

work.description: As an undergraduate research assistant at the Information and Intelligence Group, I used multi-agent reinforcement learning to experiment with different policies for improving the health of social media platforms. Specifically, I developed and tested various algorithms for modeling the interactions between users and the platform, with the goal of maximizing key metrics such as user engagement and satisfaction while minimizing negative outcomes such as spam and disinformation. Overall, this experience gave me valuable insights into the application of reinforcement learning to complex social systems, and I believe my findings could have broader implications for the design of online communities and platforms.
contributions: Developed Markov decision process to model decision-making in social media environment
Created multi-agent environment in Python to extend an existing economic simulation framework
Implemented PPO deep reinforcement learning algorithm using RLlib and Tensorflow to train agents to make optimal decisions in multi-agent environment
Applied trained models to evaluate different policies and strategies for improving health and performance of social media platforms

publications.title: The shape of inspiration: Exploring the narrative story trajectories and self-transcendent elicitors within inspirational movies
publications.description: Dale, K., Fisher, J.T., Liao, J., & Grinberg, E. (2022). The shape of inspiration: Exploring the narrative story trajectories and self-transcendent elicitors within inspirational movies. Paper submitted to the 22nd annual meeting of the International Communication Association (Paris, FR).

projects.name: Mechanisms of Misinformation
projects.description: The radical change social media has brought to our information ecosystem has created one of the biggest problems our world faces today: misinformation. With economic, social, and political implications, researchers have directed their attention to ways in which this problem can be understood and solved. Recent work has shown that articles from misleading sources can be told apart from mainstream sources by the topology of their Twitter diffusion networks. This project expands on these findings by attempting to answer the question: can the diffusion networks of misinformation articles reveal a set of ways in which misinformation spreads on social media? To accomplish this, the Twitter diffusion networks of over 700 articles from low credibility sources were converted to embeddings using the UGraphEmb graph embedding algorithm and clustered using k-means clustering. From here the differences in topological features of diffusion networks belonging to different clusters will be analyzed and explained. The hope is to use these results to better inform social media policy and algorithm design.

projects.name: Product Cupid
projects.description: People love personalized recommendations but are weary of the privacy they give up to get them. This project aims to reconcile both of these seemingly opposite desires. By creating a recommendation system that only relies on volunteered user preferences, the hope is to show that it is possible to create a privacy-first recommendation system. This project is still under development, namely the AI recommendation algorithm, but so far a simple proof of concept was built.
contributions: Led development of full stack product recommendation app that used gamification techniques to enhance user experience of searching for products
Developed Flask-based REST backend to manage product data and feed product recommendations to frontend
Created dynamic and responsive frontend using React.js, Material UI, and Javascript for real-time data updates through HTTP requests to backend
Created continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipeline using Github and Heroku to streamline development process and ensure seamless user experience
